item.title: World of Warcraft and Diablo 4’s Mountain Dew In-Game Promotion Explained
item.description:
Mountain Dew has unveiled an in-game rewards promotion that spans World of Warcraft , Diablo 4 , and other popular games, marking a new chapter in its long-standing association with gaming. This promotion, which also features Rockstar Energy and Doritos, allows players to redeem digital rewards for various titles by collecting points from participating products. Running from November 4, 2024, through January 31, 2025, this collaboration offers gamers exclusive transmogs, pets, and even a fiery motorcycle mount for World of Warcraft .

The latest Mountain Dew promotion brings back Game Fuel's Citrus Cherry flavor alongside a new Citrus Blackberry, each celebrating World of Warcraft’s 20th anniversary. This refresh of Game Fuel continues a nostalgic connection between Mountain Dew and the gaming community, a partnership that stretches back to early 2000s gaming culture when Game Fuel became a staple at gaming tournaments and esports events.

World of Warcraft and Diablo 4 Rewards Breakdown

Gamers who participate in this promotion will find a range of in-game rewards tailored to specific titles. Diablo 4 fans, for instance, can redeem their points for five unique transmogs, each designed for various character classes. Available items include The Man Opener, ideal for Barbarian, Druid, and Necromancer classes; The Thirsting Bird, suitable for Druid, Necromancer, Rogue, and Sorcerer; and the Spiritborn-exclusive Savoring Glaive and Dueling Dervish. Players can also acquire Battle Pass tier skips.

World of Warcraft’ s offerings include cosmetic items like two unique tabards—Bot Wrangler’s Violet and Crimson Aprons—and three new pets: Thrillbot 9000, Chillbot 9000, and the returning Lil’ Ragnaros, a familiar face from the Battle.net store. Perhaps the most eye-catching item is the Hateforged Blazecycle, a striking motorcycle mount with a fiery design.

Other Games Get In on the Mountain Dew Action

Beyond World of Warcraft and Diablo 4 , other major games are part of this Mountain Dew promotion. Players of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 can unlock the Mountain Dew Erickson S-64 Air-Crane. Madden NFL 25 players have access to an exclusive Ultimate Team player. Meanwhile, The Elder Scrolls Online players can redeem points for the Morthal Jarl Finery costume.

How to Access the Mountain Dew Rewards

From November 4, 2024, players can begin collecting points by purchasing select Mountain Dew, Rockstar Energy, and Doritos products, including 20-ounce and 12-pack Mountain Dew cans and Doritos XXL bags. Each product comes with a unique code, redeemable on the Mountain Dew Gaming Rewards website, where players can track and exchange points for in-game rewards. The promotion includes several popular flavors and product designs featuring the gaming franchises, from Diablo 4 to Madden NFL 25 .

Expanding Mountain Dew’s Gaming Legacy

Mountain Dew’s latest promotion for Diablo 4 , World of Warcraft , and other games serves as a nod to its historic ties to gaming. Game Fuel has evolved from a tournament favorite to a recognizable gaming accessory, now bringing digital rewards to some of today’s top games. The influence of Mountain Dew on gaming culture is so prominent, it's seeped into pop culture, including popular shows like South Park . By associating with major titles, Mountain Dew not only reconnects with long-time fans but also introduces its brand to newer gaming generations, reaffirming its relevance within gaming culture.

item.title: Horizon Zero Dawn: How To Get Goose Skin
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Acquire Goose Skin In Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered
  • Why You Need Goose Skin In Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered

The expansive world of Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered is filled with rich flora and fauna. While the flora won’t be running away from you, obviously, the same can’t be said for the fauna. Defeating the animals isn’t the most challenging task here, but finding them in the first place is.

One animal that can be particularly hard to locate is the Goose. Unlike Foxes and Boars, this bird is not abundant in the game’s environment, making it difficult to gather resources from it. Thankfully, the guide below will help you by providing information on where to farm these elusive birds.

Where To Acquire Goose Skin In Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered

Don’t be surprised if you’ve never seen a goose in your playthrough of Horizon Zero Dawn . This elusive bird is indeed very rare. Fortunately, there’s one spot where you can reliably hunt several at once.

  1. Reach the Campfire shown in the video above ( northeast of Mother's Watch and Northwest of Mother's Cradle).
  2. Head north from the campfire and take a sharp right at the two lit torches .
  3. Follow the path, jumping over any gaps, and climb up the walls until you reach a platform with a zipline.
  4. Use your Focus here to spot around a dozen geese in the southern area below.
  5. Start hunting as many Geese as you can.

Stay on the platform and hunt as many geese as possible from above before rappelling down to collect your loot. This way, you’ll likely gather a few Goose Skins.

Why You Need Goose Skin In Horizon Zero Dawn Remastered

Given how rare geese are in the game, it’s fortunate that you don’t need many Goose Skins for crafting. In your first playthrough, you’ll only need one Goose Skin. In New Game Plus, you’ll need two, and in NG+ with Ultra Hard difficulty, three. The following items require Goose Skins:

  • Tearblaster Ammo Pouch Upgrade 4: 1 Goose Skin
  • Adept Rattler: 1 Goose Skin in NG+ or 2 Goose Skins in NG+ with Ultra Hard difficulty

If you end up with extra Goose Skins, you can sell them to a merchant for 30 Metal Shards each.

item.title: Once Human Dealing With More Server Lag Issues
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Once Human is currently experiencing server lag issues.
  • The scope of the ongoing problems is currently unclear, with Starry Studio merely saying that the issues aren't affecting all servers.
  • The developer apologized to any affected players and promised to compensate them for their troubles.

Once Human is presently suffering from server lag issues, Starry Studio has confirmed. The Chinese developer also promised some compensation for Once Human players affected by the ongoing situation.

Starry Studio's post-apocalyptic survival game was originally released for PC in early July 2024. Its free-to-play nature and compelling gameplay loop helped it quickly establish a sizable audience, with the game peaking at over 231,000 concurrent Steam players shortly following its debut. But this level of success appears to have even taken Starry Studio by surprise, as underlined by the fact that Once Human suffered from long queue times and server problems at launch.

Four months later, some of these issues appear to still persist. Specifically, Starry Studio has just confirmed that it has recently identified more server lag problems with the game. While the exact scope of the problem is currently unclear, the developer said that the lag is only affecting select servers. Given this state of affairs, the company is currently working on "urgent fixes," having said as much in a November 1 tweet. It remains to be seen whether these fixes are delivered via a server- or client-side Once Human update.

Once Human Developer Promises Player Compensation for Server Lag Issues

Starry Studio's latest announcement also saw the company commit to compensating all Once Human players affected by the ongoing issues. The specifics of its compensation package are yet to be revealed. Twitter reactions to the developer's announcement appear somewhat mixed; while some fans thanked the studio for working to address the problems, others claimed that server lag has been a long-standing issue with Once Human , wondering why the company has taken so long to merely identify it.

And while it's true that server lag has troubled the game for months now, there's no way to tell whether all of its occurrences have the same root cause. It's also possible that Starry Studio has already resolved some such issues, only for even more of them to arise. The pattern of social media complaints about Once Human ’s network issues—which have been coming in waves since the game’s July 2024 release rather than consistently—supports this theory.

This isn't the first time that Starry Studio decided to apologize to its players with some freebies. The company most recently did so in mid-October 2024, when it compensated Once Human players affected by server lag issues with a varied array of items, including Mitsuko's Marks, Stardust Sources, and Gunpowder. As always, the developer is still asking players who encounter any sorts of bugs or other issues to report them in-game or using its Discord Feedback Desk.

item.title: The Sims 4: Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • The Sims 4 Ghost Mastery Skill Tree, Explained
  • How to Use Ghost Abilities in The Sims 4
  • Ghost Abilities in The Sims 4
    • Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier One: Wispling
    • Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Two: Ethereal Novice
    • Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Three: Phantasmal Ascendant
    • Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Four: Spectral Luminary
    • Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Five: Transcendent Wraith

The Life & Death expansion has revitalized one of the most overlooked occults in The Sims 4 , introducing depth and functionality to the afterlife. Ghosts have been given their own skill tree, which allows them to progress through five tiers of Ghost Mastery and earn experience points to unlock new abilities. This progression allows players to customize their Ghost Sim’s supernatural strengths, adding a layer of strategy and immersion for those wanting to explore life on the other side.

Whether players prefer a mischievous ghost who delights in causing trouble or a helpful spirit looking to lend a hand, the Ghost Mastery skill tree offers countless ways to shape a Ghost Sim’s supernatural journey. Dive into the details of each ability and perk below, and discover how to make the most of a Ghost Sim’s unique afterlife experience.

The Sims 4 Ghost Mastery Skill Tree, Explained

Much like other advanced occult species in The Sims 4 , such as vampires and werewolves, Ghost Sims can unlock new abilities and perks through Ghost Mastery . Players can access the Ghost Mastery skill tree from the Simology Panel. It has six branches, each representing a different style of ethereal power.

On the left side of the tree, Ghost Sims can pursue malevolent powers, from terrifying the living to inflicting curses. Whereas the right side of the tree leans toward benevolent abilities that allow Ghost Sims to provide positive auras or even repair and upgrade skills. A middle, neutral branch also exists, offering abilities such as teleportation and slowing or stopping need decay entirely.

Using the ghostly abilities from this skill tree grants Ghost Sims experience and helps them advance through the five tiers of Ghost Mastery. Ghosts will begin as a mere Wispling and work towards becoming a Transcendent Wraith. Passing through these levels earns Sims experience points , which can be used to purchase additional abilities and perks.

Ghost powers can co-exist with powers from other occults. Sims who were werewolves, vampires, and spellcasters during their lifetime can retain their occult powers and experience while also working on leveling up their ghost mastery.

How to Use Ghost Abilities in The Sims 4

All ghostly abilities in The Sims 4 are powered by stamina . The stamina bar, which can be viewed in the Simology Panel, displays the status of a ghost's stamina. If the stamina bar is low, a Ghost Sim will appear faint and translucent, requiring some time to recharge before they can use their powers again. When fully replenished, the Ghost Sim will return to their vibrant, spectral appearance, ready to use their abilities to haunt or help as they please.

Ghost Sims will find the purchased abilities under the social pie menu; to access it, players can click on another Sim. Here, they will find the Ghost Mastery menu and they can pick between Helpful, Comfort, Chaos, and Scare Abilities . Players can also find the Ghost Mastery menu on objects for interactions like Sinister Haunt and Instantly Upgrade.

Some interactions, such as Solace Embrace, require the ghost Sim to have a high relationship with the targeted Sim.

Ghost Abilities in The Sims 4

The Ghost Mastery skill tree has five ascending tier: Wispling, Ethereal Novice, Phantasmal Ascendant, Spectral Luminary, and Transcendent Wraith. As they level up, Ghost Sims gain experience points and unlock opportunities for new abilities and perks. These abilities must be purchased from the bottom up, much like the celebrity perks system.

Players will want to explore each tier's unique abilities and perks so they can plan their Ghost Sim’s supernatural progression.

Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier One: Wispling

Ability

What It Unlocks

Spooky Spectacle

The ability to Flicker Lights and Ghostly Bang to scare nearby Sims.

Conjurer

Summon dirty trash, puddles, and spooky objects to make a mess.

Ghostly Traverse

Teleport using Traverse to travel on terrain and Spectral Unlock to unlock any door.

Transcendent WooHoo

Turn living Sims into temporary ghosts for ethereal WooHoo.

Solace Embrace

Detect Current Mood of a Sim and calm their negative feelings.

Dispeller

Clean trash, dirty dishes, puddles, and messes to improve relationships and make Sims happy.

Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Two: Ethereal Novice

Ability

What It Unlocks

Object Manipulation

Haunt musical instruments to improve instrument skills and Sinister Haunt possessable objects.

Dark Presence

Influence nearby Sims' emotions by emitting a negative aura.

Fear The Night

Cause living Sims to be more vulnerable and fearful at night, and receive a Fear Essence bonus.

Spectral Slumber

Sleep inside possessable objects to restore stamina faster.

Euphoric Presence

Radiate positivity and influence Sims' positive feelings.

Novice/Adept/Expert Maintenance

Clean, repair, and upgrade objects. Requires three experience points for Expert Maintenance.

Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Three: Phantasmal Ascendant

Ability

What It Unlocks

Haunting Shriek

Perform a Haunting Shriek that scares nearby Sims (and may cause them to faint).

Dream Corruptor

Disturb Sims' sleep with nightmares.

Suppress/Transcend Living Needs

Slows/Stops need decay in terms of hunger, bladder, and hygiene. Requires two experience points to Transcend Living Needs.

Dream Weaver

Give Sims good dreams and restore their energy faster.

Grim's Ride-or-Die

Save Sims from being reaped.

Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Four: Spectral Luminary

Ability

What It Unlocks

Levitator

Levitate Sims in the air and take the possessions or Simoleons that fall from them.

Devourer

Drain the needs and shorten the lifespan of a Sim.

Powerful Endurance

Use ghostly abilities with ease and less stamina.

Afterlife Quality Ensurer

Improve the quality of crafted items, plants, and food.

Altruistic Caretaker

Improve the needs and extend the lifespan of a Sim.

Ghost Mastery Skill Tree Tier Five: Transcendent Wraith

Ability

What It Unlocks

Otherworldly Curse

Receive the Mark of Evil tattoo, which gives ghosts the power to bestow curses on Sims.

Benevolent Blessing

Receive the Mark of Good tattoo, which gives ghosts the power to give living Sims fortune.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Best Weapons For Nahida
item.description:
Nahida

Dendro

Catalyst

Sumeru

Guides

Ascension

Builds

Weapons

Team Comp

Constellation

Player Mistakes

Back to All Characters

Nahida is a unit that can benefit from many different stats in Genshin Impact . She mostly requires Elemental Mastery, but other stats like Attack, Critical Rate, Critical Damage, and Dendro Damage Bonus are all great too.

The key to properly building Nahida is the ability to balance her stats out. Elemental Mastery is good, yes, but having too much of it is not ideal either. Finding out Nahida's best weapon in Genshin Impact is necessary to maximize the DPS from her Elemental Skill, allowing her to shine as a Sub-DPS.

Updated on November 2, 2024, by Nahda Nabiilah: Nahida is still one of the best Dendro characters in Genshin Impact. Her ability to consistently apply Dendro while dealing so much DMG makes her a must-have for any team that needs a Dendro unit. Not only that, she’s also capable of evolving with the meta as her utility keeps proving to be useful with every new mechanic introduced to the game. For that, this guide will be updated to include more Supportive weapons for Nahida in Genshin Impact.

16 Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers

  • Primary Stats: 401 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 35.2% HP
  • R5 Effect: When switching characters, the new character taking the field has their ATK increased by 48% for 10s. This effect can only occur once every 20s.

Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers allows Nahida to greatly increase the next character’ ATK by 48%. It can be beneficial for a DPS who scales with ATK, but not at the cost of losing some of Nahida’s DPS and utility. Unfortunately, other than the ATK% buff, Nahida doesn’t take anything else from Thrilling Tales of Dragon Slayers, which makes it a niche choice for Nahida’s best weapons.

15 Favonius Codex

  • Primary Stats: 510 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 45.9% Energy Recharge
  • R5 Effect: CRIT hits have a 100% chance to generate a small amount of Elemental Particles, which will regenerate 6 Energy for the character. Can only occur once every 6s.

Favonius weapons in Genshin Impact can always be a good choice for Supports because of their ability to regenerate Energy for the team. While Nahida doesn’t need this extra utility since she’s operating many useful ones on her own, it’s still a good addition for her if you’re struggling to find a good Catalyst for Nahida in Genshin Impact .

14 Magic Guide

  • Primary Stats: 354 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 187 Elemental Mastery
  • R5 Effect: Increases DMG against opponents affected by Hydro or Electro by 24%.

Considering how good Nahida is, it's not at all a bad idea for beginner players to get her in the early game. Since Sumeru area is not quest-locked like Inazuma, it won't even be hard to access the required boss for Nahida's Ascension in Genshin Impact . Magic Guide is a viable weapon for players who don't have access to better Catalyst; it increases Elemental Mastery by a large amount while also buffing Nahida's damage against enemies affected by Hydro or Electro, so it's perfect for both Bloom and Quicken team comp.

13 Blackcliff Agate

  • Primary Stats: 510 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 55.1% CRIT DMG
  • R5 Effect: After defeating an opponent, ATK is increased by 24% for 30s. This effect has a maximum of 3 stacks, and the duration of each stack is independent of the others.

Blackcliff is always good for damage dealers in Genshin Impact because of its CRIT DMG substat and ATK bonus. However, for Nahida, this Catalyst exists mostly just for the substat. She benefits from the ATK buff, but not as much as she would with Elemental Mastery. Additionally, as a Sub-DPS, it can be hard for her to ensure the passive continuously stacks.

12 Sacrificial Fragments

  • Primary Stats: 454 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 221 Elemental Mastery
  • R5 Effect: After dealing damage to an opponent with an Elemental Skill, the skill has a 80% chance to end its own CD. Can only occur once every 16s.

Nahida doesn’t really need the passive of Sacrificial Fragments considering her Elemental Skill only needs five or six seconds to be available again. Meanwhile, her Tri-Karma Purification stays for up to 25 seconds. However, this Catalyst is good for its immense Elemental Mastery substat.

11 Sacrificial Jade

  • Primary Stats: 454 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 36.8% Crit Rate
  • R5 Effect: When not on the field for more than 5s, Max HP will be increased by 64% and Elemental Mastery will be increased by 80. These effects will be canceled after the wielder has been on the field for 10s.

Sacrificial Jade offers a decent amount of Crit Rate and Elemental Mastery for Nahida in Genshin Impact . It’s not a perfect weapon for her, but definitely a useful one. With Sacrificial Jade, you’re able to build Nahida with more Crit DMG, especially considering she also gets an extra Crit Rate from her Ascension Passive. The extra Elemental Mastery is also nice since it’s one of her Core stats in Genshin Impact .

10 Hakushin Ring

  • Primary Stats: 565 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 30.6% Energy Recharge
  • R5 Effect: After the character equipped with this weapon triggers an Electro elemental reaction, nearby party members of an Elemental Type involved in the elemental reaction receive a 20% Elemental DMG Bonus for their element, lasting 6s. Elemental Bonuses gained in this way cannot be stacked.

Hakushin Ring is only viable for Nahida if players are playing her in a Quicken team composition. At the cost of her personal DMG, Nahida can grant Elemental DMG buff for both Electro and Dendro characters. One thing to keep in mind is that she needs to trigger the Elemental Reaction for the passive to take effect.

9 Wandering Evenstar

  • Primary Stats: 510 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 165 Elemental Mastery
  • Effect: The following effect will trigger every 10s: The equipping character will gain 24% of their Elemental Mastery as bonus ATK for 12s, with nearby party members gaining 30% of this buff for the same duration. Multiple instances of this weapon can allow this buff to stack. This effect will still trigger even if the character is not on the field.

Wandering Evenstar is a weapon-banner exclusive, so getting it may be tough. At R1, the buff provided by this weapon is not too significant, but at R5, it's a decent option. However, of course, buffing the team should not be the main purpose for this Catalyst, since 144 extra ATK for the team from 1000 Elemental Mastery (at R5) is not that high, while 480 extra ATK for the wielder is a great addition.

8 Solar Pearl

  • Primary Stats: 510 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 27.6% CRIT Rate
  • R5 Effect: Normal Attack hits increase Elemental Skill and Elemental Burst DMG by 40% for 6s. Likewise, Elemental Skill or Elemental Burst hits increase Normal Attack DMG by 40% for 6s.

Solar Pearl can easily buff Nahida’s Elemental Skill DMG as long as players use her Normal attacks first. At maximum refinement, this battle pass weapon can get close to a low-stacked Kagura’s Verity. Since the Spiral Abyss requires players to be as fast as possible, Solar Pearl’s performance shouldn't be underestimated.

7 Lost Prayer To The Sacred Winds

  • Primary Stats: 608 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 33.1% CRIT Rate
  • Effect: Increases Movement SPD by 10%. When in battle, gain an 8% Elemental DMG Bonus every 4s. Max 4 stacks. Lasts until the character falls or leaves combat.

Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds is actually not that good for Nahida, but the fact that it is a 5-star weapon in Genshin Impact saves it from being underwhelming. The weapon’s passive is good if players are playing her actively on the field, but considering she shines better as a Sub-DPS, the passive sadly has to go to waste.

6 Skyward Atlas

  • Primary Stats: 674 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 33.1% ATK
  • Effect: Increases Elemental DMG Bonus by 12%. Normal Attack hits have a 50% chance to earn the favor of the clouds. which actively seek out nearby opponents to attack for 15s, dealing 160% ATK DMG. Can only occur once every 30s.

Skyward Atlas is better than Lost Prayer of Sacred Winds simply because of its passive that Nahida can fully benefit from. However, keep in mind that Skyward Atlas is terrible on Nahida if players are using her in a Quicken team comp .

5 Mappa Mare

  • Primary Stats: 565 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 110 Elemental Mastery
  • R5 Effect: Triggering an Elemental reaction grants a 16% Elemental DMG Bonus for 10s. Max 2 stacks.

Mappa Mare is the best F2P Forgeable weapon for Nahida in Genshin Impact . It has an Elemental Mastery substat which Nahida really benefits from, and a passive that is easy to stack as long as Nahida triggers an Elemental Reaction. But, it is important to ensure that the Catalyst is on high refinement rank. At lower refinement, Mappa Mare isn’t as competitive.

4 The Widsith

  • Primary Stats: 510 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 55.1% CRIT DMG
  • R5 Effect: When a character takes the field, they will gain a random theme song for 10s. This can only occur once every 30s. Recitative: ATK is increased by 120%. Aria: Increases all Elemental DMG by 96%. Interlude: Elemental Mastery is increased by 480.

It is widely known that The Widsith is one of the best Catalysts in Genshin Impact . Nahida will benefit from any of the three available buffs in the weapon’s passive, making it even more powerful than it already is.

3 Tulaytullah's Remembrance

  • Primary Stats: 674 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 44.1% CRIT DMG
  • Effect: Normal Attack SPD is increased by 10%. After the wielder unleashes an Elemental Skill, Normal Attack DMG will increase by 4.8% every second for 14s. After this character hits an opponent with a Normal Attack during this duration, Normal Attack DMG will be increased by 9.6%. This increase can be triggered once every 0.3s. The maximum Normal Attack DMG increase per single duration of the overall effect is 48%. The effect will be removed when the wielder leaves the field, and using the Elemental Skill again will reset all DMG buffs.

The Dendro Archon often takes the role of the Main DPS in the team, since she's usually the most reliable Dendro enabler. Because of this, enhancing Nahida's Normal Attack with this Catalyst is not a poor idea. Additionally, the weapon also offers Crit DMG substat, which is great for the rest of Nahida's kit.

2 Kagura's Verity

  • Primary Stats: 608 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 66.2% CRIT DMG
  • Effect: Gains the Kagura Dance effect when using an Elemental Skill, causing the Elemental Skill DMG of the character wielding this weapon to increase by 12% for 16s. Max 3 stacks. This character will gain 12% All Elemental DMG Bonus when they possess 3 stacks.

Nahida can maximize Kagura's Verity’s buff because its stack will refresh when a new stack is obtained, but this can only be achieved after 18 seconds, constantly switching in and out. It is good on paper, but in actual battle, Nahida likely won’t enter the field every five or six seconds, so players will need more time to maximize the weapon’s passive.

1 A Thousand Floating Dreams

  • Primary Stats: 542 Base ATK
  • Secondary Stats: 265 Elemental Mastery
  • Effect: Party members other than the equipping character will provide the equipping character with buffs based on whether their Elemental Type is the same as the latter or not. If their Elemental Types are the same, increase Elemental Mastery by 32. If not, increase the equipping character's DMG Bonus from their Elemental Type by 10%. Each of the aforementioned effects can have up to 3 stacks. Additionally, all nearby party members other than the equipping character will have their Elemental Mastery increased by 40. Multiple such effects from multiple such weapons can stack.

A Thousand Floating Dreams is amazing for Nahida as her best build relies on players having a balance between Elemental Mastery, Dendro DMG Bonus, and Critical stats. This Genshin Impact Catalyst grants up to a 30% Dendro DMG Bonus, preventing players from over-stacking Elemental Mastery.
